article_title: Mt. Lebanon water main break interrupts service to 20 customers
article_text:
In addition to utility workers, the Mt. Lebanon Fire Department also responded to the scene.

Lobaugh said an 8-inch main broke, and had been shut off.

Pennsylvania American Water spokesman Gary Lobaugh said service should be restored by early evening. The break damaged the lawns of two homes on Valleyview Drive, and Lobaugh said a disaster restoration team from the utility was on site to work with the homeowners.

About 20 customers are without water Saturday in Mt. Lebanon because of a water main break.
